#### Comparing prioritization scores

<br>
<section style='font-size: 12pt; text-align: left'>
This plot compares individual priority variables for selected area to regional averages. The variables used in the prioritization layer are shown on the left-hand y-axis. The scaled and standardized score(s) are shown on the bottom x-axis. Scores of the selected geography are shown in green, while the regional averages are shown in blue.
</section>

<br>
<section style='font-size: 12pt; text-align: left'>
If this report is for a city or neighborhood with multiple Census tracts, you will see error bars for the selected area. The green bar shows the average (mean) value of all tracts within the selected area, and the error bar shows one standard error from the mean. 
</section>
